intro: Senecio psidiifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf groundsels, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. The plant's adaptability to harsh environments makes it an important component of its native ecosystems.
